ygData.subject: RE: Weapons at level 9 and up
ygData.msgSnippet: Hmmm, odd. Been hunting him lately (mostly as payback for so many ignoble deaths) but also - he is about the only thing in there that gives me xp anymore.
ygData.messageBody:
Hmmm, odd.

Been hunting him lately (mostly as payback for so many ignoble deaths) but
also - he is about the only thing in there that gives me xp anymore.

Perhaps he rarely will - but in a couple dozen kills - I've found the
pattern pretty solid.

BTW, he IS a BIT easier to kill if he's just punching - I can NEARLY solo
that sucker now if he doesn't have that little pig sticker in his hand.

Do warriors ever get that kind of damage power at that level? 44+ damage 4x
a round?


At 10:34 AM 7/13/99 -0500, you wrote:
>From: "Jones, Brian" <brian.jones@...>
>
>When I got mine off of him he did NOT have it wielded.
>
>> ----------
>> From: silky@...[SMTP:silky@...]
>> Reply To: eqbards@onelist.com
>> Sent: Tuesday, July 13, 1999 10:31 AM
>> To: eqbards@onelist.com
>> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Weapons at level 9 and up
>>
>> From: silky@...
>>
>>
>> Now, if he's holding it, he's got it - same with Lord Darish in front of
>> the throne, if he's holding the axe, he has it.
>>
>> I've turned the heart in numerous times - Lord Jyleel in the basement of
>> the paladin guild in felwith takes it, as well as illegible scrolls off
>> the
>> oracles.
>>
>> Can't say much for that quest, gotten as little as a few coppers - as much
>> as a few gold and a minor spell scroll. Hardly worth the effort to zone
>> into felwith for, unless you are going there anyway. I usually pick up one
>> of each in crush - bank them till I decide to head over to felwith for
>> somethin - and make a roundtrip back with mail for kelethin. Does seem to
>> help your faction in felwith quite a bit tho.
>>
>>
>>
>>
>> At 07:06 AM 7/13/99 -0500, you wrote:
>> >From: "Jones, Brian" <brian.jones@...>
>> >
>> >I tried to help a ranger get a dirk off Dvinn (I already had mine, as
>> did
>> >the enchanter I usually group with). We fought Dvinn 7 times, and he
>> had a
>> >heart 3 times, dark elf parts the other 4. No Dirk. Suffice to say the
>> >ranger was a little perturbed. Of course he had no idea on the stats of
>> the
>> >dirk at the time, he was actually only killing him for his heart.
>> >
>> >Cwelenas, Minstrel of the 6th Chord
>> >Angarth Bladedancer, Warrior of the 21st Tier
>> >"Periissem ni periisem"
>> >
>> >
>> >> ----------
>> >> From: Sean Gifford[SMTP:giffords@...]
>> >> Reply To: eqbards@onelist.com
>> >> Sent: Tuesday, July 13, 1999 5:12 AM
>> >> To: eqbards@onelist.com
>> >> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Weapons at level 9 and up
>> >>
>> >> From: "Sean Gifford" <giffords@...>
>> >>
>> >> People don't sell the Dragoon Dirk for nearly as cheap now, (I found
>> out
>> >> for
>> >> myself) because now Dvinn does not always have the Dagger on him. You
>> >> have
>> >> to kill him 3 or more times to get one these days. I managed to get one
>> >> for
>> >> 30plat.
>> >> ----- Original Message -----
>> >> From: John Kim <kim@...>
>> >> To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
>> >> Sent: Monday, July 12, 1999 3:07 PM
>> >> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Weapons at level 9 and up
>> >>
>> >>
>> >> From: John Kim <kim@...>
>> >>
>> >> On Mon, 12 Jul 1999, Schafer, Timothy L 1425 wrote:
>> >> >
>> >> > Hang out just outside Crushbone, they usually will loot
>> >> > Dvinn, run outside and auction it, I have seen them sell
>> >> > for 10 pp. You might get lucky. The dragoon's dirk is
>> >> > better than almost any combine/well balanced weapon. I
>> >> > would not waste any money on the store bought variety,
>> >> > Demon claws are nice, but very expensive, and so is the
>> >> > PGT,
>> >>
>> >> While the dirk by all means should be your first magic weapon,
>> >> the combines are still a good choice.
>> >>
>> >> If you are around L10 and have managed to save enough for a
>> >> combine and can't/don't want to make the trek to Crushbone for
>> >> a dirk, by all means buy one. You should be able to sell it
>> >> later to a player for a profit, or to a merchant at a 10%-15%
>> >> loss, so they do not really cost as much as their price
>> >> indicates. While the dirk has dropped the bottom out of the
>> >> combine rapier market, the combine longsword and scimitar
>> >> markets are still doing well because several classes that can
>> >> use those but cannot use the dirk.
>> >>
>> >> If you are L17 or higher and already have a dirk, a combine
>> >> for your off hand can be a good choice for the same reason.
>> >> If you ever upgrade your off-hand weapon, you can easily
>> >> liquidate the combine and get 80%-90% of your money back (more
>> >> if you sell it to a player). Unless you need the money *now*
>> >> for something else, most combines only end up costing 5-10pp
>> >> to own.
>> >>
>> >> --
>> >> John H. Kim
>> >> kim@...
>> >>
